title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, January 20, 1869
summary: Scott provides details about the arrival of a new teacher, Margaret Burke, and describes a frustrating encounter with the pastor of the local Methodist church, stating that the "colored minister" forced Burke to conduct her class in the overcrowded and ill-furnished basement of the church.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
